Authors: Anusha Hasini Ekanayaka, Kevin D Hyde, Qi Zhao
Title: The genus Cookeina
Abstract:
Cookeina (Sarcoscyphaceae) is characterized by large,
brightly coloured, stipitate apothecia and eccentrically, operculate
asci. This paper provides detailed morphological descriptions of the
sexual morphs of all the recorded species within the genus, including a
new species, Cookeina garethjonesii. Phylogenetic analyses inferred from
ITS sequence data strongly support species lineages with corresponding
morphological differences.
